_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The all that is oppressed [sn35.29:1.19]: The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact
What oppresses the all [sn35.29:1.19]: The fires of greed, hate, and delusion
The ear, nose, tongue, body, mind that i: The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact
The process of disillusionment and freed: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact.
They grow disillusioned with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact.
They grow disillusioned with the ear, nose, tongue, body, mind, and the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact.
When desire fades away, they're freed.
When they're freed, they know they're freed.
They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
